title: MEA to Indians abroad: Comply with local laws and regulations
content: Indian nationals abroad are expected to comply with local laws and regulations, says the Indian government as authorities detain Badar Khan Suri and Ranjini Srinivasan faces visa cancellation. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal emphasizes that neither approached Indian authorities for assistance. Suri was detained for allegedly spreading 'Hamas propaganda'. The government underscores respect for sovereign immigration policies.

title: How this Bengaluru ‘fake cop’ extorted couples for years over 'public indecency'
content: For 15 years, Asif Khan posed as a cop and blackmailed couples in Bengaluru, extorting money and valuables. Recently arrested by the Jayanagar police, Khan's long con included 19 victims. Authorities recovered gold and money, urging others affected to lodge complaints.

title: Columbia University agrees to policy changes amid 'anti-semitism' row
content: Columbia University agreed to policy changes after the Trump administration froze $400 million in federal funding over antisemitism concerns. Measures include a mask ban, new disciplinary protocols, and campus police authority to make arrests. The university will also appoint new leadership and develop a K-12 curriculum on antisemitism to address the situation.

title: IPL 2025’s star attraction: The battles within battles
content: Amid all the talk of team dynamics, the T20 league’s 18th season will also be about individual skills, match-ups, split-second decisions and unique subplots.

title: Cost cutting by DOGE may 'pain' TCS, Infosys, and other Indian IT firms as well
content: India's IT companies are expected to face a delayed recovery, with weak discretionary spending and global trade tensions impacting growth. Analysts predict a challenging fiscal 2026, with only modest revenue increases and competitive pressures arising from the early stages of AI adoption.

title: 'Came out weeping': Two-and-a half year old girl raped in Madhya Pradesh
content: A two-and-a-half-year-old girl was raped by a neighbor in Satna town on Thursday. The accused lured the toddler, and after being sexually assaulted, she informed her mother. The family reported the incident, leading to the perpetrator's arrest under the Pocso Act. State Congress president Jitu Patwari criticized the government's response to crimes against women.

title: 'We don’t want to be here anymore': Passengers left annoyed at Heathrow Airport
content: Passengers at London’s Heathrow Airport faced major disruption as fires broke out at the electrical substation, causing flights to be diverted midair. This led to significant delays, including for comedian Adam Conover. British Airways passengers at JFK in New York also experienced long queues and confusion while trying to rebook flights. Heathrow's CEO assured operations would resume by Saturday.

title: 'Pakistani security forces fired on protesters in Quetta, one dead'
content: Prominent Baloch activist Mahrang Baloch has condemned Pakistani security forces for opening fire on peaceful protesters in Quetta, causing injuries and one death. At the UNHRC session in Geneva, the repression in Balochistan was highlighted, including enforced disappearances, targeted killings, and intimidation tactics against political activists and human rights defenders.

title: ChatGPT tells a father he murdered his own children
content: A Norwegian man, Arve Hjalmar Holmen, lodged a complaint after ChatGPT falsely claimed he murdered two of his children. Digital rights group Noyb alleges this breaches GDPR regulations. OpenAI acknowledged the issue, noting improvements in newer ChatGPT versions to enhance data accuracy.

title: 'Mini heart attack': IndiGo flyer stunned as seat becomes loose mid-air
content: A passenger's row of seats on an IndiGo flight from Delhi to Lucknow became loose mid-flight, causing a terrifying experience. The airline has apologized and announced an investigation into this rare maintenance issue to prevent any future occurrences.

title: Heathrow Airport back to life: First flight touches down after 18-hour shutdown
content: British Airways resumed operations at Heathrow Airport after an 18-hour disruption caused by a severe electrical substation fire. The incident led to mass flight cancellations, affecting around 200,000 passengers and highlighting concerns about the resilience of Britain's infrastructure.

title: Haryana: JJP leader Ravinder Minna shot dead in Panipat
content: JJP leader Ravinder Minna was shot dead in Panipat on Friday, with his cousin and another person also injured in the attack. Five police teams have been formed to apprehend the accused. This incident follows the killing of BJP leader Surendra Jawahra in Sonipat over a land dispute.

title: NSCN (I-M) junks Delhi’s alleged mining bid in Nagaland
content: The extremist group also accused the Centre of forming a coalition of rival groups to counterweight the Framework Agreement of August 2015.

title: Minorities Commission urges States to promote Gurmukhi
content: Chairman of National Commission for Minorities Iqbal Singh Lalpura writes to State governments also about preserving the history and cultural heritage of the Sikh community

title: Karnataka bandh LIVE updates: Pro-Kannada groups observe 12-hour statewide bandh amid tight security
content: Kannada organisations held bike rallies, marched in several parts of the State and appealed to the shopkeepers to cooperate and extend their support for the cause

title: Deocha Pachami locals take to Kolkata streets to protest against coal project
content: On February 6 this year, mining work started at the DPDH coal block to excavate basalt and consequently, the underground coal reserves. Although West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee promised a lucrative compensation package and emphasised that no land would be forcibly acquired, protests erupted in the area against anticipated evictions and environmental damage.

title: M.P. Minister announces cop’s suspension after Congress MLA’s emotional plea over ‘fake case’
content: Abhay Mishra, Opposition MLA from Semariya in Rewa district, alleged that the “false FIR” had been filed against him and his son Vibhuti Narayan Mishra in the Chorhata police station following a road accident in 2022 as he pleaded for action against the concerned police officers.

title: Bobbili Fort in Vizianagaram: Where memories of an iconic battle stay alive
content: A museum housed in Bobbili Fort in Vizianagaram commemorate a battle fought between two kingdoms in the region over 250 years ago, a conflict marked by bloodshed, revenge and colonial intrigue

title: Visakhapatnam - A city of military might and cultural splendour
content: Strategically located along the coast of Bay of Bengal, the port city is home to various military and cultural museums, showcasing the country’s proud naval history and the rich heritage of the Telugu people

title: Ben Stiller, 400-plus celebs urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: Israel kills Hamas military intelligence chief Osama Tabash in Gaza
content: Israel's military has eliminated Osama Tabash, the head of Hamas's military intelligence in southern Gaza, in an airstrike. Tabash, a veteran member of Hamas, was responsible for significant intelligence and strategic operations in the region. His death is considered a major blow to Hamas's intelligence and operational capabilities in the ongoing conflict.

title: IPL 2025, KKR vs RCB: New leaders, fresh start
content: Rajat Patidar returns to Eden Gardens, where his career soared in 2022. Now captaining for the first time in IPL, Patidar faces pressure to lead RCB to their first trophy. KKR, under new skipper Ajinkya Rahane, who boasts an impressive international leadership record but mixed IPL captaincy results, aims to defend their title amid significant team changes.

title: IPL 2025: Will KKR vs RCB be spoiled by rain in Kolkata?
content: Persistent drizzle interrupted practice sessions of KKR and RCB at Eden Gardens, ahead of their IPL 2025 opener. The Indian Meteorological Department has warned of severe weather including thundersqualls and moderate rainfall, potentially disrupting the planned opening ceremony and match schedules.

title: Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava emerges highest-earning with Rs 2.10 cr
content: Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava enters its fifth week with a stellar box office collection of Rs 575 crore, despite competition from new releases and controversies. The film, based on Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj's life, has faced piracy issues, with legal action being taken against those responsible.

title: Cash recovery at judge Yashwant Varma’s home: CJI may decide on inquiry today
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna sought a report from Delhi High Court Chief Justice D K Upadhyay regarding the recovery of cash from Justice Yashwant Varma's residence. The CJI will consider setting up an inquiry panel based on the findings. Justice Varma was recently transferred back to Allahabad HC.

title: The Diplomat: John Abraham starrer opens week 2 with low Rs 1.25 crore
content: The John Abraham starrer The Diplomat opened with promise but saw its earnings decline, amassing Rs 20.40 crore in its second week. Despite initial setbacks, including rejections from OTT platforms, the film remained profitable due to its Rs 20 crore budget. It outperformed the Hollywood release Snow White, generating significant interest among fans.

title: Join TOI's Amazing Heart, Amazing Life Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Was special cell stalking gangster Nadir Shah before and during his murder in Greater Kailash-1 last Sept?
content: Nadir Shah, a gangster-turned-businessman, was murdered in front of a gym in GK-I, with several Special Cell officers nearby. The Greater Kailash police were kept from investigating, raising suspicions and questions about the involvement or oversight of the special cell.

title: 'He looked like somebody that belonged': Stephen A. Smith'S u-turn on Bronny James
content: Stephen A. Smith, previously critical of Bronny James, has changed his stance after Bronny's impressive performance against the Milwaukee Bucks. Smith acknowledged Bronny's elevated confidence and poise, crediting the Lakers' coaching staff for his development, while reiterating his unchanged views on LeBron's influence.

title: Taylor Swift frustrated over involvement in 'It ends with us' legal dispute
content: Taylor Swift has been inadvertently drawn into a legal dispute between Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni over the film It Ends With Us. Though not involved with the movie's production, her connection to Lively has made her a topic in the controversy, much to her displeasure.

title: Delimitation JAC meeting LIVE: Today will be etched in history, says Stalin
content: Stalin said if Tamil Nadu and other States lose representation due to the upcoming delimitation process, it will strike at the very foundation of federalism in India

title: Nagpur violence: 14 more held, number of arrests reaches 105; 3 fresh FIRs registered
content: Nagpur CP said the decision to lift the curfew from some parts of the city would be made after a high-level review meeting

title: Trinamool to skip delimitation meet in Chennai, to focus on voter IDs
content: Trinamool Congress feels the duplicate voter ID number issue is more important at present, as it may have an impact on the Assembly polls in Bihar, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal.

title: Amid crackdown on farmers, SKM, BKU (U) skip talks in Punjab
content: ‘Create a conducive environment for talks, release those detained’; some other farmer leaders attend the meeting; SKM defers proposed march

title: Meerut murder case: Deceased’s kin allege involvement of ‘occult practices’
content: Saurabh Rajput was allegedly drugged and then stabbed to death by his wife and her lover on March 4, his body dismembered and sealed inside a drum with cement

title: Tulsi Gabbard's India visit highlights strong U.S.-India relationship: DNI
content: Ms. Gabbard also joined the Raisina Dialogue where she delivered keynote remarks on the collective effort to drive toward Mr. Trump's goals of a peaceful, free, secure, and prosperous society

title: Amit Shah takes 'kaala chashma' jibe at Rahul Gandhi
content: Mr. Shah said that whenever we see a terrorist, we shoot right between the eyes. Our government can neither tolerate terrorism nor terrorists

title: Hoping to rebuild ties with Canada: India
content: New Delhi's comments came days after Mark Carney took charge as Canada's new Prime Minister following the exit of Justin Trudeau from the top office.

title: Expert panel formed for construction of Shivaji memorial in Agra
content: ‘The place where Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was kept under house arrest in the city of Agra will be acquired by the Maharashtra Government, and a grand memorial will be erected there’

title: Panic persists across Bangladesh as mob violence continues unabated
content: At least 27 were killed in mob attacks in January and February alone, compared with the 32 similar incidents recorded in the first seven months of 2024, just before the ouster of Sheikh Hasina; the interim govt. promises action regardless of the religion, beliefs, or affiliations of the perpetrators

title: Table-top exercise on counter-terrorism in Malaysia, field training exercise in India to be held in next two years
content: Earlier, the European Union convened a technical workshop on preventing and countering violent extremism in Delhi, on the sidelines of the Raisina Dialogue.

title: Parbhani violence: Probe holds police accountable for law student’s death, Congress demands action
content: Maharashtra Congress president H.V. Sapkal calls the BJP-led govt. ‘anti-Dalit’, accusing CM Fadnavis of mishandling the case; calls for further investigation

title: NHAI begins work on vehicle underpasses, flyovers to decongest Edappally Junction
content: Two 650-metre-long flyovers will be built atop the Edappally-Palarivattom bypass corridor and the Edappally-Varapuzha NH 66 corridor. The space beneath them will function as underpasses for vehicles to take a 180-degree turn

title: A riot in Nagpur over a long-dead emperor’s tomb
content: On March 17, tensions escalated in Nagpur when protesters demanding the demolition of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb’s tomb allegedly burnt a chadar. A mob attacked homes, set vehicles on fire, and went on a rampage. Abhinay Deshpande and Purnima Sah report on the controversy over an emperor who died more than 300 years ago, and trace how communal flames were fanned in Maharashtra

title: Rape bid and murder accused killed in police encounter in Lucknow
content: Ajay Dwivedi and his brother Dinesh had allegedly attempted rape on the woman and then strangled her in the Malihabad area of the capital on March 18

title: Officer’s attempt to heat blank bullets in frying pan triggers scare at Kochi police camp
content: The officer opted for an instant solution to dry up the blank bullets in view of the little time left before a police funeral ceremony.

title: Madras High Court had already upheld T.N. govt’s right to fix time, age and monetary limit for online games: Home Secretary
content: Counter affidavit filed in response to a batch of new writ petitions filed by online gaming companies challenging the TNOGA regulations

title: 'Hope to rebuild ties': India after Trudeau's exit, says 'license given to extremists'
content: India expressed readiness to rebuild ties with Canada, strained over Ottawa's harboring of anti-India elements. The relations deteriorated following accusations of Indian involvement in a Canadian citizen's assassination and Khalistani protests. Progress in ensuring Indian diplomats' safety could lead to resumption of visa services for Canadians, post-Trudeau's resignation as Liberal Party leader.

title: Was Pentagon to brief Musk on ‘war’ with China? Trump says no
content: Elon Musk's visit to the Pentagon sparked controversy due to his business ties with China, leading to unfounded claims of him being briefed on U.S. war plans against China. President Trump and Musk denied these claims, asserting the meeting focused on innovation and government efficiency.

title: 'Took her to the cops': Father of Meerut woman held for husband's brutal murder
content: Muskan Rastogi confessed to murdering her husband with the help of her lover, after her father took her to the police. She attempted to hide the crime by dismembering the body and concealing it in a cement-filled drum. Investigators found evidence linking Muskan to her boyfriend Sahil, who was allegedly manipulated into participating in the murder.

title: 'Nothing like it in world': Trump unveils 6th-gen fighter jet 'F-47' to take on China
content: US President Donald Trump Friday announced the world's first 6th generation fighter jet to be built by Boeing. It will be known as F-47, the 47th US president announced adding that 47 is a beautiful number. "It’s something the likes of which nobody has seen before. Nothing in the world comes even close to it," Trump said.

title: 'Husband made her the CM ... ': Why is Nitish mocking Rabri Devi?
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has repeatedly targeted opposition leader Rabri Devi, highlighting how she became CM in 1997 after her husband Lalu Prasad's arrest. Kumar aims to consolidate women's support by contrasting RJD's nepotism with his own women-centric development schemes as elections approach.

title: 21-yo Sankar stuns world no. 2 Antonsen at Swiss Open
content: Indian badminton player Sankar Muthusamy Subramanian, ranked 64th, stunned world no. 2 Anders Antonsen at the Swiss Open Super 300 tournament, winning in three games. The Indian women's doubles team of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand also advanced to the semifinals. Other Indian players Isharani Baruah and Anupama Upadhyaya faced tough losses in their matches.

title: Preliminary exam for KAS posts: State Administrative Tribunal directs KPSC to refer unexamined questions to expert panel
content: The Tribunal said that the variation in translation would not be a ground for re-examination and interference with examination already conducted

title: Karnataka High Court orders handing over of custody of 16-year-old boy to parents from grandmother and paternal aunts
content: Acting on the ‘principle of best interest of the child’, the Bench pointed out that the dispute between boy’s parents and aunts had a detrimental effect on the minor child

title: 13 Bangladeshi nationals deported to their country, Centre tells Supreme Court
content: The verification process for the remaining illegal immigrants in detention centres in Assam is underway, says govt.

title: M.B Patil proposes land near BIAL for mega jewellery park
content: Despite global challenges like geopolitical uncertainties and tariff issues, India’s gem and jewellery sector has shown remarkable resilience, says GJEPC

title: Reconsider move to introduce CBSE in Maharashtra, says Supriya Sule
content: Ms. Sule questioned the implementation of the CBSE pattern, which ignores the existing education system in Maharashtra

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman Dhankhar speaks on judicial accountability, reminds MPs of NJAC Bill
content: Supreme Court clarifies Delhi HC judge judge transfer not linked to fire incident; Opposition raises concerns in Rajya Sabha

title: Nagarjuna Sagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve has 76 tigers, says annual report
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan releases the Annual Report and also unveils logo of Nagaravanams on the occasion of International Day of Forests

title: National Defence College team in A.P. for study tour
content: The team met with A.P. Chief Secretary and discussed the welfare programmes, Swarnandhra 2047 Vision Plan, and recently launched WhatsApp governance

title: Normal operations resume at NMDC as protesting workers return to work
content: NMDC resumes operations after worker protests, shares rise by 1.47% on BSE, aiming for 45 million tonnes production in FY25

title: As PM Modi’s Nagpur visit draws near, police focus on restoring normalcy in RSS hub
content: So far, 99 persons have been arrested and 13 cases booked; city court remands 17 more people to police custody on ‘serious’ charges; Central and State officials prepare to receive the Prime Minister on March 30; Maharashtra CM Fadnavis had termed the violence was a ‘planned incident’

title: A.P. to fill 948 anganwadi posts, boost to womens’ employment
content: The move aims to strengthen child welfare and boost job opportunities for women across 26 districts in the State.

title: Manipur is peaceful, dialogue between Kuki and Meitei communities initiated: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said he sincerely hoped that through dialogue the distance and division between the Kuki-Zo and the Meitei community would be bridged in the near future

title: Indian Navy carries out critical medical evacuation of merchant vessel crew off Goa
content: Two naval ships and a helicopter were involved in evacuating three crew members with severe burn injuries from the vessel, 230 nautical miles west of Goa; one more crew member died before the rescue

title: NCP factions withdraw complaints against Rajya Sabha members
content: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar said based on the stand taken by leaders of both parties, he felt that it was “expedient to give quietness to both the petitions”

title: There is progress on GM food crops, says official
content: DBT Secretary Rajesh Gokhale’s remark comes amid apprehensions over the Environment Ministry’s approval for commercial cultivation of GM mustard in 2022; Supreme Court is scheduled to hear petitions next month

title: Chhattisgarh government announces special incentives for ‘Maoism free’ Panchayats
content: Under the scheme, a panchayat would have to facilitate the surrender of every resident of its constituent villages who had been involved in the activities

title: Wages in four tea gardens in north Bengal being delayed, admits Centre
content: Wages delayed in north Bengal tea gardens, protests over land allocation for tourism, highlighting laborers’ plight and demands

title: LaunchPad 2025: ‘Dare to Disrupt’ summit begins at BITS Pilani Hyderabad
content: BITS Pilani Hyderabad kicks off LaunchPad 2025, a 3-day summit fostering entrepreneurship with startups, investors, and industry leaders

title: Lok Sabha approves Demands for Grants of ₹50 lakh crore for various Ministries
content: Opposition MPs slam Govt for police action against protesting farmers in Punjab; Agriculture Minister hits back by saying Congress and AAP were “walking arm-in-arm” during Lok Sabha elections

title: Amid accusations, Veena George hints at failed plan to meet Nadda in Delhi on ASHAs agitation
content: Ms. George holds discussions with Cuban delegation in Delhi on March 20. She said that she tried to meet Mr. Nadda as she had assured the ASHAs on March 19

title: BBMP issues 3,000 provisional new khatas to property owners
content: A total of 2.87 lakh applications were received for securing the digital document, according to the civic body

title: Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate the new AKG Centre on April 23
content: The new CPI(M)] State headquarters will be a nine-storey high-rise with offices and a press conference hall

title: AAIB to investigate all IndiGo tail strikes
content: There have been at least six known incidents of tail strikes involving A321 Neo planes in two years; AAIB to examine training and procedural lapses

title: Unseasonal rains leave mango growers worried over their crop prospects, hailstorms hit parts of north Telangana
content: Untimely rains coupled with gusty winds hit parts of Dharmapuri, Dharmaram, Thimmapur and various other mandals in the former undivided Karimnagar district

title: BJP accuses Congress of doing ‘contract jihad’ in Karnataka
content: BJP MP and national spokesperson Sambit Patra alleged that the Congress was using appeasement in a bid to achieve its political ambitions and it was creating a division in the country.

title: In push for made-in-India browser, a mandate to trust government encryption
content: Zoho, which won the Centre’s ₹1 crore browser challenge, must use an Indian root certificate, which major browsers have not trusted since a 2014 security breach; will achieve Indian Internet resilience, says IT Secy

title: Bee attack at the Thiruvananthapuram Collectorate sparks safety concerns and ecological debate
content: Forest officials voice concerns about the ecological impact of destroying the natural ecosystems of honey bees that play a vital role as pollinators. The situation has also cast a spotlight on the inadequate maintenance of public office premises and highlights the need for regular upkeep and pre-emptive measures to avoid a repeat.

title: Thrissur to host mega job fair under Vijnana Keralam project on April 26
content: Core objective of project is to generate employment opportunities for educated youth by enhancing their skill sets according to the demands of the job market

title: Father and three sons among five held in murder of TDP leader’s father in Kurnool
content: Murder the result of a long-standing rivalry between two families and the deceased was the father of the 30th Division Corporator, says Kurnool SP

title: Govt. redesigning master plan for development of Vizag: Minister
content: The Visakhapatnam vision document and master plan for the next 30 years will be released in four months, says P. Narayana

title: Alleged drug trafficking: action sought against unregistered wayside shops in Kozhikode
content: Police urged to conduct inspections in suspected shops reportedly frequented by drug pushers to expand their network

title: Two-time heavyweight champ Foreman dies at 76
content: George Foreman, a two-time heavyweight champion, Olympic gold medalist and Hall of Fame boxer, died Friday at age 76.

title: Sources: Winston joining Giants for 2 years, $8M
content: Free-agent quarterback Jameis Winston announced Friday that he has agreed to sign with the New York Giants.

title: Flagg (ankle) comes out of Duke win fully healthy
content: Cooper Flagg had 14 points, 7 rebounds, 4 assists and 2 blocks in about 22 minutes for Duke on Friday, later saying his ankle was no worse for the wear.

title: Calipari, Pitino not close but share 'great' respect
content: Rick Pitino and John Calipari again will be in the spotlight when St. John's takes on Arkansas on Saturday. It's a relationship rooted in respect, even though the coaching greats acknowledge they're not close.

title: Hamilton wins China GP sprint for 1st Ferrari win
content: Lewis Hamilton took his first win as a Ferrari driver after securing a lights-to-flag victory in the sprint race at the Chinese Grand Prix.

title: Ingles given rare start; autistic son able to watch
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch gave Joe Ingles his first start since January 2022 on Friday night, allowing his autistic son Jacob the chance to see him play.

title: 'Diversity' off MLB careers page after exec order
content: Major League Baseball has taken references to diversity off its careers page as it evaluates programs in light of an executive order.

title: A&M's Williams addresses 'dangerous' online hate
content: Texas A&M guard Jace Carter says he has been the target of death threats and racial slurs on social media this season.

title: Sources: VCU's Odom emerges as top UVA target
content: VCU coach Ryan Odom has emerged as the target for the Virginia job, and a deal is expected to come together in the upcoming days, sources told ESPN.

title: Women's NCAA tournament Day 1 guide: Analysis and recaps of all 16 games
content: From blowouts to one double-digit seed advancing, we break down all Friday's chalky opening to women's March Madness.

title: 38 names to know for next year’s NFL free agent class: Who could end up available and get paid?
content: Who are the top names to know for next year's NFL free agency? Here's our list of who might be available and has a chance to get paid.

title: Two years after losing the Texas job, Chris Beard right at home at Ole Miss
content: The university and the city of Oxford have welcomed the coach as he rebuilds the men's basketball team.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: From All-Star to architect: How Buster Posey plans to rebuild the Giants
content: The future Hall of Fame catcher turned president of baseball operations has a vision to bring baseball glory back to San Francisco.

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Panama made it three straight victories over the U.S. in tournament play as Mauricio Pochettino's side slumped to a 1-0 defeat in the Concacaf Nations League semifinal that showed the Americans at their worst.

title: Almada golazo gives win to Messi-less Argentina
content: Argentina didn't miss Lionel Messi, Lautaro Martínez and other key players on Friday and beat Uruguay away 1-0 in convincing fashion in their South American World Cup qualifying match.

title: 'You're my idol': Henry joins Panama celebrations
content: Panama's Cecilio Waterman celebrated one of the biggest goals in his country's history, to defeat the USMNT, with his idol Thierry Henry.

title: Leon kicked out of Club World Cup by FIFA
content: Grupo Pachuca confirmed that the FIFA appeals committee on Friday ruled Club León out of participation in the 2025 Club World Cup due to the tournament's multi-ownership rules.

title: Lewis-Skelly sets England record with debut goal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly made history on Friday by becoming the youngest player to score on his senior debut for England when he found the back of the net in the Three Lions' victory over Albania at Wembley Stadium.

title: Wood carded for signing autographs in NZ win
content: Chris Wood picked up a yellow card for signing autographs and taking pictures with fans during New Zealand's win over Fiji in their World Cup qualifier on Thursday.

title: Salah scores in Egypt World Cup qualifying win
content: Captain Mohamed Salah scored for Egypt as they eased to a 2-0 victory over Ethiopia in their 2026 World Cup qualifier on Friday, but 2022 semi-finalists Morocco needed a late winner from Bilal El Khannouss to defeat unfancied Niger.

title: Disgruntled Poch: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shocking 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: Alisson set for Liverpool return after concussion
content: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson Becker has withdrawn from the Brazil squad after sustaining a concussion during Thursday's World Cup qualifier with Colombia.

title: Your guide to March Madness Day 1: Recaps, every winner's chance to advance, more
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Thursday.

title: From Dunk City to Rupp's Runts: Maryland's Crab Five the latest iconic CBB squad nickname
content: College basketball has produced many memorable squad nicknames over the years. Maryland's "Crab Five" is the latest.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: MMA madness: 16 welterweights go head-to-head
content: Is your hoops bracket already busted? Welcome to MMA madness, where predictions -- and upsets -- abound!

title: Real or not: Fundora undisputed, Boots will unify, and Ryan will solve Mayer in rematch
content: Our experts discuss notable upcoming fights, Keith Thurman's return, the next American heavyweight and more.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Forecaster for Week 1: March 27-30
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster preview, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Early contenders and who can't be ruled out just yet
content: A month into the MLS season, whose play has put them into early contention for MVP? And which preseason favorites shouldn't be written off yet?

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan to drop Leao's release clause, Chelsea interested
content: AC Milan are willing to discount Rafael Leao's release clause, and Chelsea could land him. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Is the 2025 field the most talented NASCAR has ever seen?
content: Twenty-five drivers in the 2025 NASCAR field have won Cup Series races, making it arguably the deepest ever.

title: India's Advice To Students In US As Trump's Deportation Policy Gains Pace
content: The Indian government has asked its citizens studying in the US to comply with American laws after a researcher was arrested and another student had to self-deport to Canada.

title: Video: UP Woman's Holi Celebrations With Lover, 11 Days After Cement Murder
content: Just 11 days after killing her husband, chopping up his body and leaving it to rot in a cement-lined drum, Muskaan Rastogi was playing Holi with her lover Sahil Shukla in Manali, laughing and posing for a video as if nothing had happened.

title: Karnataka Bandh Today Over Belagavi Bus Conductor Attack, Security Tightened
content: The shutdown in Karnataka is likely to disrupt transport services as some auto-rickshaw, cab, and private driver unions have extended their support.

title: "Transfer Should Be Put On Hold": Harish Salve To NDTV On Judge Cash Case
content: Calling himself a "trenchant critic" of the Collegium system Senior Advocate Harish Salve has said it is not equipped to deal with cases like the alleged recovery of huge piles of cash from Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma.

title: "Our Hope Is...": After Trudeau Exit, India Recalls "Licence To Extremists"
content: Days after Mark Carney replaced Justin Trudeau as Prime Minister of Canada, India, on Friday, recalled "the downturn in India-Canada relations".

title: "Held My Thighs, Grabbed Neck": NIT Professor Arrested For Sexual Harassment
content: An Assistant Professor at the National Institute of Technology (NIT) in Assam's Silchar was arrested on Friday for allegedly sexually harassing a female student, police said.

title: Trump Awards Next-Generation F-47 Fighter Jet Contract To Boeing
content: US President Donald Trump announced Friday that Boeing has been awarded a major contract for the Air Force's high-tech next-generation F-47 fighter plane.

title: UK Man, 28, Opts For Euthanasia Rather Than Living With Mental Illness
content: A 28-year-old British-Ghanaian artist has opted to end his life with euthanasia rather than continue living with a mental illness.

title: "Coming To Terms With...": Missing Indian Student's Parents Break Down
content: The parents of Indian student Sudiksha Konanki, who went missing from a beach in the Dominican Republic on March 6, have said in an emotional announcement that they are coming to terms with the fact that she has drowned.

title: US Revokes Temporary Status Of 5 Lakh Migrants, To Face Deportation Soon

title: Test now to verify potency in 2017 not legal: Bombay HC
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.
